column4: my sendmail went bust during the upgrade to 9.10. can someone help?
best to just ask the channel your actual question (on a single line)
does it work with the maintainer's /etc/mail?

I don't think I've ever installed sendmail, but I presume like most packages it has a default config that gives you some sort of basic setup.  If that's true of sendmail, did it work before you used your /etc/mail?
i think the sendmail is fine. i'm not sure how to evaluate it but seemed ok.  it's getting it to forward local mail to my gmail account with domain masquerading that's the tricky part.
you might want to try the #sendmail channel to see if there were some configuration changes as well
ocean_: thanks. so mail.log shows this:Nov 14 14:40:16 monstr sendmail[23439]: nAEMdmbg023438: SYSERR(root): hash map "authinfo": unsafe map file /etc/mail/auth/client-info.db: Permission denied
that just means the old file had the uid that mysql now has
have any idea who should own authinfo.db ? root?
nope, you don't have your old /etc/passwd?
i seem to not have an old /etc/passwd.
don't know.  What user does sendmail run as?
the #sendmail channel could probably tell you exactly what you need to do if you give them your error
use find and with -exec and chown
thanks. i'll fix the permissions and move there. can you give an example?
for example: find /some/directory -user olduser -exec chown newguy '{}' \;     (you should run the command without -exec first to make sure it doesn't do something stupid)
